pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:0.5: 17. The training rule on swinging the arms
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swinging their arms and resting them on supports while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.3: “‘I will not swing my arms while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.4: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not swing one’s arms;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.5: one should walk keeping the arms steady.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.6: If a monk, out of disrespect, swings his arms and rests them on a support while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk17:1.10: The seventh training rule is finished.
